ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: «Kwɔ́ʼ tà ńkúu mvfò mèŋ, gù, mbɔɔ Áloŋ mbɔɔ Nandab, mbɔɔ Ambiyu, ńgÿo mekěm pa Ésàlayɛ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a; pi lâ pɔ̌ tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńguʼte wɔ́ɔn.
en: Then he said to Moses, “Go up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of Israel’s elders,   and bow in worship at a distance.

ngiemboon: Gù Mǒonsê gíle gù zɔ ge gÿo tsóte nnɛ́, é kẅɛ́te wɔ́ɔn; petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, é le tsóte nnɛ́ wɔ́, aláʼ piŋ le cʉ́me nzèm gù, pi lâ pɔ̌ pʉ wɔ́.
en: Moses alone is to approach the Lord, but the others are not to approach, and the people are not to go up with him.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la tó, ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn, mbɔɔ mentÿɔgɔ́, éshwóŋo láʼ. Aláʼa ntsèm pú ńdɔgɔ tàʼ ncwò, ńtsɔ́ʼ ngie: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́ɔ, peg ge gÿo.»
en: Moses came and told the people all the commands of the Lord and all the ordinances. Then all the people responded with a single voice, “We will do everything that the Lord has commanded.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la pú ńŋweʼe meshwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo ńdu ssé tsɛ̀ɛ mbaʼámbaʼ; ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, á tsìŋe lekwɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńtáŋte metǒon ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, wɛ̌wɛ̌ tóon wɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ na lezíŋ tàʼ na mengẅɛ̀ ndá pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém.
en: And Moses wrote   down all the words of the Lord. He rose early the next morning and set up an altar and twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel at the base of the mountain.

ngiemboon: À la túm púɔshùm Ésàlayɛ ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńnuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ḿbiŋ ńzẅé melúm fòŋ ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ we mbʉ́lè á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Then he sent out young Israelite men, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed bulls as fellowship offerings to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la záʼ metse tsetsɛ̀ɛ, ńnéŋe tàʼa gwǒŋ tsɛ̀ɛ mekáŋa jùa; ḿbiŋ ńdɔgɔ pfwɔ̀ʼ ńzaa jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: Moses took half the blood and set it in basins; the other half of the blood he splattered on the altar.

ngiemboon: Ḿbíi ŋwàʼne kʉ̀a, ńtóŋo mbwó láʼ; epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gɔɔn ngie: Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́ɔ, peg ge gÿo, é piŋ júʼ ncwò wé.
en: He then took the covenant scroll and read it aloud to the people. They responded, “We will do and obey all that the Lord has commanded.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la kaa pfwɔ̀ʼɔ metse, ńdɔg ńzaa láʼ, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mɔɔn ée metse kʉ̀a gie pi lâ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gwa, ńcʉa na mɔɔn meshwóŋè.
en: Moses took the blood, splattered it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the Lord has made with you concerning all these words.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê pɔ́ Áloŋ, mbɔɔ Nandab, mbɔɔ Ambiyu, ńgÿo mekěm pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a pú ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɛ́.
en: Then Moses went up with Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of Israel’s elders,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la kúu wó, ńgyá Ssé pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ. Á laa metsìŋ mekwò yé, mé ne ńgyá ssé tsetsáʼ gwɔ́ páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tóon gẅie mé tóŋo lê Safii la, á ne ŋwʉŋe, ńgẅiin liŋé ngénʉ̀ŋ páʼ lefaŋ fʉ̀ʼ gie é ne ńkyɛ́ʼɛ.
en: and they saw   the God of Israel. Beneath his feet was something like a pavement made of lapis lazuli, as clear as the sky itself.  # 24:10 Ezk 1:26; Mt 17:2; Rv 4:3

ngiemboon: E Ssé la te gÿo tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na mekěm pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ wɔ́. Pɔ́ la gyá Ssé, afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, pɔ́ pfɛ́ mmó, ḿbiŋ ńnú.
en: God did not harm   the Israelite nobles; they saw  # 24:11 Gn 32:30; Ex 19:21 him, and they ate and drank.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: Kwɔ́ʼ lé mvfò mèŋ, á ndùm lekwɛ́, ńnéŋe wó; n ge gÿo, é ná melàŋa tóon mie n da ŋweʼe lepʉ̌ mbɔɔ metÿɔgɔ́ mǒ, páʼ ɔ̀ ge lɔg zíʼi wɔ́b.
en: The Lord said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain and stay there so that I may give you the stone tablets   with the law and commandments I have written for their instruction.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê pɔ́ Yǒonshûa gẅie aa nkẅèpwó we la kwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɛ́ se Ssé.
en: So Moses arose with his assistant Joshua and went up the mountain of God.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó mekěm ngie: Pi ké ńzẅíʼte wég pɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn tà ńkú fʉ̀ʼ gie peg ge piŋ nzèm, é tsɛ́ɛ gẅí. Áloŋ pɔ́ Ûu ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi; nyìŋ lɔɔn ńcʉ́ʼ ńgẅiin nò gie mé ge táŋte, á gyá wɔ́b.
en: He told the elders, “Wait here for us until we return to you. Aaron and Hur are here with you. Whoever has a dispute should go to them.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la kwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɛ́, melɔ́ɔn pú ńjÿó sɛ̌ lekwɛ́.
en: When Moses went up the mountain, the cloud   covered it.

ngiemboon: Legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la pú ńgwɔ́ ndùm lekwɛ́ Sinayi, melɔ́ɔn piŋ ńjÿó sɛ̌ lekwɛ́ jÿǒ lyɛ̌ʼ ntɔgɔ́. Á gwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, á fó tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo Mǒonsê.
en: The glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. On the seventh day he called to Moses from the cloud.

ngiemboon: Aliŋé legúʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a laa menÿɔ́g pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g gẅie é la ne ńkÿó ntoŋ lekwɛ́.
en: The appearance of the Lord’s glory to the Israelites was like a consuming fire   on the mountaintop.

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê la shúu tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn, ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɛ́. À la tsẅé ndùm lekwɛ́ pafʉ̀ʼʉ zsǒ móm lekùɔ, ńgÿo paletsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ.
en: Moses entered the cloud as he went up the mountain, and he remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
